caption: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins 7-1 at home on Saturday, Oct. 21. Goals came from Nikita Kucherov (2), Steven Stamkos, Yanni Gourde, Brayden Point, Anton Stralman, and Mikhail Sergachev. The PPG from Stamkos was the 113th of his career, making him the franchise's all-time leader for power-play goals and passing Vinny Lecavalier (112). Additionally, Stamkos' assist on the Sergachev goal was his 600th career NHL point.
message: Photo courtesy of Scott Audette/Tampa Bay Lightning.
name: Tampa Bay Lightning

message:
TONIGHT: Bolts vs. Canes!

caption: The Tampa Bay Lightning fell 5-4 in shootout to the New Jersey Devils at Prudential Center on Tuesday, Oct. 17. Goals came from Vlad Namestnikov, Ondrej Palat, Nikita Kucherov, and Steven Stamkos. With his goal, Kucherov joins Mario Lemieux as the only players in the last 30 years to score a goal in each of their first seven games.
message: The Tampa Bay Lightning fell 5-4 in shootout to the New Jersey Devils at Prudential Center on Tuesday, Oct. 17. caption: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Detroit Red Wings 3-2 on the road on Monday, Oct. 16. Goals came from Tyler Johnson and Nikita Kucherov (2). The first of Kucherov's goals made history as he became just the fourth player in 30 years to score a goal in each of his team's first six games (Yzerman, Lemieux, Tkachuk).
message: Photo courtesy of Dave Reginek/NHLI.
name: Tampa Bay Lightning

message:
On joining elite company: "I'm just trying to help my team get a W. I don't want to put much in my head."

Bolts-Wings | Nikita Kucherov:
name: Tampa Bay Lightning

message:
"The traits of a player of [Kucherov's] magnitude is he makes players around him better as well."

message:

The other three? Steve Yzerman, Mario Lemieux, Keith Tkachuk.

caption: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins 5-4 at home on Thursday, Oct. 12. Slater Koekkoek scored his first and second career NHL goals, and Steven Stamkos tied a franchise record (Lecavalier) with his 112th career power-play goal. Other goals came from Victor Hedman and Alex Killorn.
